actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to allow a tax credit to individuals who reside in certain States to counter the effects of an imbalance in the Federal tax to Federal benefit ratio.

summary.text: Fair Share Tax Reduction Act - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow a refundable income tax credit to individuals living in States where: (1) the Federal spending ratio was less than 90 percent; and (2) the average unemployment rate was greater than ten percent or greater than 150 percent of the average of the national rate of unemployment. Sets forth the method of calculating such income tax credit. Defines "Federal spending ratio" as an amount determined by dividing the sum of all amounts spent within a State by the Federal Government by the sum of all amounts of revenue generated within such State.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to allow a tax credit to individuals who reside in certain States to counter the effects of an imbalance in the Federal tax to Federal benefit ratio.
